result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sydney L Borden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Sarah A Ponath in court.   Defendant Sydney L Borden did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to amended charge in Case #15CM2023
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.  **no paper copy in physical file**
Cover letter dated 05/10/16, filed by Atty Ponath.
Authorization to appear received and filed by Atty Ponath.

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court with Attorney Sarah A Ponath.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath provides some counseling documentation.  Attorney Ponath requests a plea and sentence date in May, 2016.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

(Fax) from Attorney Ponath requesting court to advance cost of medical records.

2/11/16 - Court grants Atty Ponath's request to advance the cost of producing the requested medical records in the amount of $169.76.

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court with Attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns along with other case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Atty Sarah Ponath was already appointed on 15CM2023 (contract).

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Petition for appointment of counsel provided to the defendant.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
